medical_history.chief_complaint: Presence of reticular pseudodrusen (RPD) in the retina.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient 1 was diagnosed with a high-grade, poorly differentiated right lower lid sebaceous cell carcinoma in September 2013. She had widespread RPD throughout the macula and above the arcades in both retinae, observed on dilated fundus examination just before her operation. Patient 2 underwent an exenteration of the right eye due to an aggressive sclerosing basal cell carcinoma. She presented with scattered intermediate drusen but no evidence of RPD.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Patient 1 has a history of asthma and no systemic illnesses. Patient 2 has a history of rheumatic heart disease, hypertension, and hypercholesterolemia, and underwent aortic valve replacement in 2002.
medical_history.family_history: Patient 1 has a strong family history of AMD: both her parents and sister were diagnosed with AMD. Patient 2's family history is not specified.
